body_html:
@soumith and Team, really appreciate that 5.0 support is brought back. It helps those with home rigs and learners, but the issue is most of us use K10 it is at CUDA 3.0
Outright even pytorch tutorials including transfer learning hymenoptera_data example fails, mercilessly.
Many learners may struggle to get access to latest and greatest GPU s. Tesla K10 /Cuda 3.0 offers relief to them.
While i fully appreciate the actions for the issues of binaries weighing down heavily, there is much greater issues here. It is a risk to invest in learning pytorch.
Is it possible to document and release a standard way to make sure cuda 3 works? I will offer to help and publish a document, if guided. Will compiling from source work? what are the dependencies for latest ubuntu? Where to start? Is it possible to use cuda 3 or we have to feel left out and just move away from pytorch!
